column5: "A bit more demanding than shuffleboard. . ." That is a wonderful example of being ****ed by faint praise.

Thanksgiving can mean different things to different people. Turkey, fixins and football, are part of the picture for some, for others it may be gathering together with friends and families. Still others a day to plan for Black Friday shopping! So what does Thanksgiving mean? For me, I am thankful for my wife, son, family and all of the big and little blessings I enjoy! I have a very fulfilling career, I am able to take trips to Ontario, and B@B's and vineyards.So what are you Thankful for?
You are a little late, Canadians celebrated thanksgiving last month.
SHELLBACK! You made coffee come out my nose! Anyway, I am gratful for may things including visiting beauty and bounty of the Canadian shield - one of my favorite places on earth.
That neither myself nor any of my children have grown up and become curlers.
I'm thankful no one has asked about a DUI and crossing the boarder in the last few days!

I am thankful for my family and and many great friends, thankful for my health and being able to fish whenever I want. Thankful for the freedom I have to enjoy life, thanks to our veterans and active service people who have and are fighting to keep us free.God Bless the USA and all my friends on WC
Family, friends, provisions, grace, AND a wife that understands that 2 trips to Canada each year are just a part of life.

Tis a grand sport. Not fast paced but for the most part folks of most ages can compete. A bit more demanding than shuffleboard, more skills & team effort but fun. Back in the mid 60's we had some world championship rinks from Appleton WI club. Right along with the Pack!
Tis indeed a grand sport.It can be played as relaxed or competitively as one wishes.It is the greatest of the winter games
